SAN FRANCISCO CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
MERCHANTS EXCHANGE BUILDING
465 CALIFORNIA
STREET
January 5, 1927.
Airport Committee of the
Board of Supervisors of the
City and County of San Francisco,
City Hall,
San Francisco,
California.
Attention of MR. MILO F. KENT, Chairman.
Gentlemen:
At a joint meeting held January 4, 1927, of the Aerial
Affairs Committee
of the San Francisco Chamber of Commerce, a special
committee of
aviators serving for the Chamber of Commerce, and a
committee from the San Francisco Chapter of the National Aeronautical
Association, the offer of the South San Francisco Chamber of Commerce
of the free use of a temporary airport site at South San Francisco was
considered.
As a result, these three committees, which represent the
entire sentiment of the aircraft industry in San Francisco, have gone
on record as unanimously recommending:
That the Board of Supervisors of the City and County of
San Francisco accept the offer dated December 22, 1926, of temporary
site made by South San Francisco Chamber of Comnerce,
and proceed im-
mediately to put this into condition to be used as San Francisco's
airport;
2:
It is further recommended that the Board of Supervisors
appropriate a sufficient sun of money to enable the United States
Weather Bureau to make daily meteorological records of the weather and
wind conditions on certain proposed permanent sites on the Peninsula,
to be specified, for a period of a year;
It was the sense of these Committees that at the end of
this time, the flying experience on the temporary field and the records
of the Weather Bureau should all be taken into consideration in select-
ing a permanent field, although Weather Bureau records were not to
outweigh any favorable flying experience that might have prevailed on
